intro: Draba rockii, commonly known as the Tibetan wintercress, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers and has a low-growing, mat-forming habit. Draba rockii is often found in alpine meadows and is well-suited to the harsh conditions of its native habitat.
